title: Do you think it is possible to learn something new from Udemy courses? - Quora

response.answer_text: Online education is most affordable platform where you can learn the new things everyday as per your convenient time. Platform like coursera, edx, udemy, linkdin, udacity provides the lot of high quality courses on technology, business and personal development which improve your skillset. On Edx and coursera you will find the best courses from top universities in the world, if you have some financial problem then also you can enroll in the courses there, by selecting audit option and financial aid option, and learn some amazing things as per your interest. On the other side, on udemy and linkdin you will find all types of professional courses and these courses were taught by industry experts in there own field ( best seller courses) , who having more than 20 yr of experience. Just Think that you will learn here the 20 years professional experience of that experts in 10 to 12 hr of course , really a amazing. So go for it and learn as much as possible, if you learn more then you earn more because your skillset grow your career. Hope this help

While choosing to buy a particular course, I typically check if the course is either “Highest rated” or “Best seller”, the background of instructor and check the reviews / QA forums to see responsiveness of the instructor. If it ticks these boxes, then I am pretty optimistic to learn something new from that course -;)

Hi Ruchi, thanks for the A2A! I’m slightly puzzled by your question. The question sounds like it comes from somebody who’s heard about Udemy and wonders whether it might be a good idea to enroll in classes. But it isn’t the case, as you are a Udemy instructor! You should be able to answer your own question quite nicely! As for my answer, yes you can. I have enrolled in many courses and learned A LOT. And if you want to learn German, you can learn a lot from my courses ☺

Yes, there is always something new that one can learn from online courses on Udemy. However, it is not true for every instructor. While enrolling to a course, look for the instructor's credentials. There are a lot of people talking about a lot of things on Udemy. But I feel that instructors from a specific background, with specialization, would do better than a jack of all trades. Again, it is up to the individual. But if the student is smart, she will learn from everywhere and everything. Thanks for asking. Let me know if you have more questions. I blog at www.TheIndianFreelancer.com

Yes, I believe it is completely possible. With technology penetrating into our daily lives, the way we learn is also evolving rapidly.Udemy and other such portals offer a wide variety of online tutorials.A person can choose his area of interest and start the learning journey. I’m a Software Professional and currently I’m learning Statistics from Udemy.Last week I completed one course and this week enrolled into another one.The same can be learned from books as well, but because of time constraints I prefer such tutorials. Hope this clarified your doubt!
